intro: Allosorus zippelii, commonly known as the Zippel's allosorus, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
